decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells and removal spells while also using powerful equipment to enhance its creatures. The main strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay, while also using efficient threats like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to close out the game. The deck also makes use of mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Deathrite Shaman to quickly establish a board presence. The inclusion of Leovold, Emissary of Trest adds another layer of disruption and card advantage to the deck.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of disruption spells and removal, while also generating card advantage through card draw and flashback abilities. The deck aims to maintain a stable board state while using efficient threats like Gurmag Angler and Young Pyromancer to pressure the opponent. By combining hand disruption, counterspells, and removal, this Grixis Control deck aims to grind out the opponent and come out on top in the late game.

The deck focuses on creating a prison-like lock on the opponent by utilizing various artifacts that restrict their ability to play spells and attack. Cards like Ensnaring Bridge, Chalice of the Void, and Sphere of Resistance limit the opponent's options, while Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland disrupt their mana base. Smokestack and Ratchet Bomb help control the board, while Lodestone Golem and Tangle Wire slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to grind out the opponent through attrition and resource denial until victory is achieved.

The focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board while putting pressure on the opponent. Utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler, along with disruption from cards like Daze and Stifle, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while dealing damage. With a solid mix of card draw, countermagic, and removal spells, this deck aims to maintain tempo and punish any missteps from the opponent. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and apply pressure with Wasteland.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent by deploying efficient threats such as Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, True-Name Nemesis, and Young Pyromancer. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Stifle to slow down the opponent. The deck also includes versatile cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to smooth out draws and find the necessary pieces to win the game. Additionally, it packs removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt to deal with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, combined with disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and Daze to control the board. It also utilizes powerful spells like Force of Will and Lightning Bolt to stay ahead in the tempo game. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early while disrupting their game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of creatures and removal spells. Mana denial with Wasteland also plays a key role in slowing down the opponent's development.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on applying early pressure through cheap, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, backed up by disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game, disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining consistent threats on the board. By utilizing a mix of creature aggression and spell disruption, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain early game pressure and disruption while utilizing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Force of Will and Daze, while also utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Grim Lavamancer to deal direct damage to the opponent. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and powerful creatures, this deck is designed to quickly overwhelm and outpace the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

Utilizing high-cost, game-ending creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand, this Legacy deck aims to cheat them into play early with cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck includes a variety of cantrips and counterspells to manipulate the hand and protect the combo pieces, while also utilizing Omnicience to cast spells for free. The inclusion of Cunning Wish adds flexibility and the ability to search for specific answers in the sideboard. The mana base includes fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to accelerate out the combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo utilizing cards like Thespian's Stage and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. This combo allows you to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token in just a few turns. The deck also includes powerful graveyard recursion spells like Reanimate and Entomb to bring back key creatures like Grave Titan and Iona, Shield of Emeria. Additionally, disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Collective Brutality help protect the combo and disrupt opponent's plans. Overall, the deck focuses on fast combo execution with graveyard synergy.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest. It also utilizes card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix, while also being able to control the board with Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The mana base is carefully constructed to allow for flexibility in casting spells of all colors, while also incorporating powerful lands like Underground Sea and Volcanic Island. The overall strategy is to control the game and dictate the pace of play.

This deck aims to generate mana quickly and efficiently with cards like Heritage Druid, Nettle Sentinel, and Gaea's Cradle in order to cast powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and win the game in a single turn. The key strategy is to use cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to untap creatures and replay them for extra mana, allowing for explosive plays. Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith help to dig for key pieces of the combo, while Natural Order serves as a powerful tutor for Craterhoof Behemoth. This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a massive board presence and finishing them off in one big swing.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to control the game by constantly disrupting the opponent's resources while generating card advantage through cards like Leovold and Snapcaster Mage. The combination of powerful spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor allows the deck to efficiently deal with threats and maintain control of the game. With a strong mana base and a variety of answers, Grixis Control can adapt to a wide range of matchups and strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Leovold, Emissary of Trest is a key card that punishes opponents for drawing cards, while Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage provide value and card advantage. Deathrite Shaman helps mana fixing and disruption. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and closing out the game with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle, and then using that mana to play out a large number of elves to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes various ways to tutor for key pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth and Natural Order to set up powerful combos and finish the game quickly. The combination of card draw with Elvish Visionary and Glimpse of Nature helps the deck maintain momentum and consistently draw into key pieces to execute its game plan efficiently.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and a high number of direct damage spells. By consistently dealing damage quickly and efficiently, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a strong defense. The focus on burn spells and low-cost creatures allows for a fast-paced, high-pressure playstyle that aims to win the game in a short amount of time.
